solution.text:
Given equations are :
_{i}_x = _{j}_y and _{i}_x - _{{2*j}}_y = _{l}_
Pick 1st equation and write y in terms of x as follows
i.e.,_{j}_y = _{i}_x
i.e.,y = \(_{i}_x\over _{j}_\)
Now, Substitute the value of y in 2nd equation.
We get
_{i}_x - _{{2*j}}_(\(_{i}_x\over _{j}_\)) = _{l}_
_{i}_x - (_{{2*i}}_x) = _{l}_
-_{i}_x = _{l}_
x = -\(_{l}_\over _{i}_\)
Substituting this value of x in equation of y in terms of x
We get
y = \({_{i}_\times {-_{l}_\over _{i}_}}\over _{j}_\)
y = \(-_{l}_\over _{j}_\)
Therefore, x = -\(_{l}_\over _{i}_\) and y = -\(_{l}_\over _{j}_\)

content.text:
Solve the following equation by the substitution method.
_{i}_x = _{j}_y and _{i}_x - _{{2*j}}_y = _{l}_
